flawed_nl_solution:
You first have to calculate the total mass of apples he had on the shelves, so you add the three kinds of apples: 23 kg + 37 kg + 14 kg = <<23+37+14=47>>47kg
Since he sold 36 kg of apples, he still has: 47 kg - 36 kg = <<47-36=11>>11kg
#### 11

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 74, not 47. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
